channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat, Inc. -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat, Inc. -- all products

item.title: CVE-2016-9585|2024-08-06T02:59:02.542Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- eap-5
item.description: Red Hat JBoss EAP version 5 is vulnerable to a deserialization of untrusted data in the JMX endpoint when deserializes the credentials passed to it. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability resulting in a denial of service attack.

item.title: CVE-2016-8629|2024-08-06T02:27:41.114Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- keycloak
item.description: Red Hat Keycloak before version 2.4.0 did not correctly check permissions when handling service account user deletion requests sent to the rest server. An attacker with service account authentication could use this flaw to bypass normal permissions and delete users in a separate realm.

item.title: CVE-2016-9606|2024-08-06T02:59:03.093Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- resteasy
item.description: JBoss RESTEasy before version 3.1.2 could be forced into parsing a request with YamlProvider, resulting in unmarshalling of potentially untrusted data which could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code with RESTEasy application permissions.

item.title: CVE-2016-9589|2024-08-06T02:59:02.944Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- wildfly
item.description: Undertow in Red Hat wildfly before version 11.0.0.Beta1 is vulnerable to a resource exhaustion resulting in a denial of service. Undertow keeps a cache of seen HTTP headers in persistent connections. It was found that this cache can easily exploited to fill memory with garbage, up to "max-headers" (default 200) * "max-header-size" (default 1MB) per active TCP connection.

item.title: CVE-2016-8612|2024-08-06T02:27:41.111Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- mod_cluster
item.description: Apache HTTP Server mod_cluster before version httpd 2.4.23 is vulnerable to an Improper Input Validation in the protocol parsing logic in the load balancer resulting in a Segmentation Fault in the serving httpd process.
